abstract: Asian stock markets rebounded Friday from the previous day’s rout, with Tokyo’s index gaining nearly 3 percent, as the U.S. bailed out Bank of America again and a weaker yen lifted exporters like Toyota Motor. Major European markets also opened higher.
lead_paragraph: Asian stock markets rebounded Friday from the previous day’s rout, with Tokyo’s index gaining nearly 3 percent, as the U.S. bailed out Bank of America again and a weaker yen lifted exporters like Toyota Motor. Major European markets also opened higher.

headline.main: Asian Stocks Gain as U.S. Bails Out Bank
